item.title: [Tutorial] Making a loader (URL & Jar)
item.dc:creator: @Punniabi16 Punniabi16
item.description:
@Punniabi16 wrote:

i just started to try this out attempting to make my own unique bot

the loader has a few missing parts which stops it from compiling.

import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.URLConnection;

the readPage(); is a little screwy
instead of

private String readPage(URL url) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
		String s = readPage(url, referer);
		referer = url.toExternalForm();
		return s;
	}

should be like this

	private String readPage(URL url) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
		String referer = url.toExternalForm();
		String s = readPage(url, referer);
		return s;
	}

or just untested idk if this works

	private String readPage(URL url) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
		return readPage(url, url.toExternalForm());
	}

unless referer was somewhere globally then it was right but it wouldn’t necessarily compile in that example.

Also Umm I still cannot compile it right
Error @

RSLoader.java:112: non-static method readPage(java.net.URL) cannot be referenced from a static conte
xt
String PageSrc = readPage(new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/p0,j0"));
                 ^
Note: RSLoader.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.

I use it like this

String PageSrc = readPage(new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/p0,j0"));
System.out.println("source: " + PageSrc);

i guess i cannot call that from main() because its static? idk… should i make readPage method static too then?
nevermind i think i’ll just put it in RSLoader class

yes it compiled i got a class file guys!

Now i’m going a step deeper and getting it to load the loader

Ok guys it spammed my console with the page source I guess I am to blame for that…

but the loader screen is blank… I can prove it if you don’t believe me

Ok guys I believe this tutorial was imcomplete on purpose for people like me so I couldn’t just copy/paste and get a loader to run plus I noticed its a year old as well obviously the loader technology got updated and this is worthless.

I will keep trying brb.
Ok back I forgot to put in runescape.jar with my loader.jar…

now that I did that I re-ran it and I have gotten this reply in console box

Reached!
Error: gh.a:299 client.init:330 loader.run:454 java.lang.Thread.run | ae

I believe the problem is it’s not compilable with the new runescape.jar

something is wrong i will figure it out brb.
back ok I will try new parameters maybe old ones are too outdated lemme try i found this thread

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


should automate adding parameters every load

just found out the url where the applet/parama’s are is outdated as well
i will try to view source the actual runescape and find it right now…
runescape is tricky they hidden it in a javascript file

the new url then is:
http://world[NUMBER_GOES_HERE].runescape.com/plugin.js?param=o0,a0,s0
you’ll see things like
document.write(’’);
document.write(’’);

which just won’t load correctly with
Freddy1990’s regex code due to the quotes they added you can remove em like I did.
Looks like this now

			String pageSrc = readPage(new URL("http://world31.runescape.com/plugin.js?param=o0,a0,s0"));
			pageSrc = pageSrc.replace("\"","");
			try {
				Pattern regex = Pattern.compile("<param name=([^\\s]+)\\s+value=([^>]*)>", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE | Pattern.UNICODE_CASE);
				Matcher regexMatcher = regex.matcher(pageSrc);
				while (regexMatcher.find())
					if (!parameters.containsKey(regexMatcher.group(1)))
						parameters.put(regexMatcher.group(1), regexMatcher.group(2));
			} catch (PatternSyntaxException ex) {
				ex.printStackTrace();
			}

Also you need to add imports
import java.util.regex.*;

I made it!

Now the question is how do I know it loads the runescape.jar from my folder and not the one from the internet?

Gotta learn some reflection now.
Why so much bcel tutorials and not alot of reflection ones? I think reflection is easier then bcel from just looking at it vs bcel… well both are pretty nice… but bcel is like a wrapper on top of something that already looks solid which is reflection.

How i inject code with reflection? or only with bcel?

Anyways good day.

Read full topic

tyvm! making a lot of sense now!So im guess the loader.class is obfuscated code?So i need to go get an obfuscater i do not have the mad skils to figure that one sure i saw one on the forums some where

ok found it and it doesnt work must be outdated hrmm, biting off more than i can chew atm ill just get this loader working for now

item.title: [Tutorial] Making a loader (URL & Jar)
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“traitors, post:34, topic:224503”]ok sort of makes sense. i just dl and had a look at the classes are they obfuscated or am i using the wrong applet to open them, im using DrJava?

[quote author=the bank link=topic=294949.msg2974645#msg2974645 date=1254184244]

thi might sound like a dumb question but how did you all figure out to download the runescape files?Is their some sort of explination, i though the browser was loaded from their server?
[/quote]It’s a Java game so you see what jar file your browser launches.

can anyone eloborate on how you find out what files you browser loads?yup newb question i know but we all started as nubs[/quote]if you are running the signed client on their site and you look at the javascript, you’ll see that it loads a file named loader.jar. but someone (dont know who) discovered that when requesting a runescape.jar/loader.jar, the http server only searches to see if the request starts with runescape/loader and ends with ‘.jar’. which means that you can download it through something like http://world1.runescape.com/runescape_eats_big_hairy_cox.jar and it will give you the same file as if you wouldve requested http://world1.runescape.com/runescape.jar. same with the loader

anyways, so you download the loader.jar, you decompile it and there is a class which contains the names, file sums and links to all of the files needed to load the signed client successfully (such as runescape.jar)

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Making a loader (URL & Jar)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s just slightly more complicated to make an HD loader than an SD loader because you have to detect the operating system you are running under and load the proper native code. If you are going to do it do it right, don’t just load the .dll’s.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Making a loader (URL & Jar)
item.dc:creator: @mhmdk mhmdk
item.description:
@mhmdk wrote:

http://world52.runescape.com/loader_gl-2129469231.jar

Works with SD and HD(even full screen). There are no extra .dll’s needed as the client gets them from the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Making a loader (URL & Jar)

item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“ifuqedurmum, post:25, topic:224503”]My Only question lies in why you set your hashmap’s base type to String,String instead of String , Integer which seems much easier in the end
I love the guide, I have little experience with the physical client and this really helped a lot :D[/quote]

because getParameter returns Strings and not Integers
